These decreases began ∼180 days after the event at the Sun at V2 and ∼245 days at V1 corresponding to average propagation speeds of 605 and 567 km/s respectively. The intensity decrease was 13.1% at V2 and 9.3% at V1. The intensity of these galactic cosmic rays recovered very slowly at V2 and V1 this recovery continuing for ∼150–120 days or more after the transient passed these spacecraft.
